noun.description: A hard igneous rock containing crystals, usually of feldspar, in a fine-grained, typically reddish groundmass.

proper noun.description: (c.232–303), Neoplatonist philosopher; born Malchus. He was a student of Plotinus, whose works he edited after the latter's death.

origin: Late Middle English: via medieval Latin from Greek porphuritēs, from porphura purple.
